children.name: BPP with circuits
Recall that a language L ⊆ Σ* is in the class BPP iff there is a randomised algorithm A such that:
keywords: Recall that a language L ⊆ Σ* is in the class BPP iff there is a randomised algorithm A such that:

children.name: 1. the running time of A is polynomial in input size, regardless of coin tosses
keywords: 1. the running time of A is polynomial in input size, regardless of coin tosses

children.name: Prob [A(w) = L(w)] > 0.6
keywords: Prob [A(w) = L(w)] > 0.6

children.name: To prepare for the quantum variant BQP, we use circuits to describe BPP.
keywords: To prepare for the quantum variant BQP, we use circuits to describe BPP.

children.name: 1. the circuit Cn has n input gates, one output gate, and can be computed by a deterministic algorithm in time poly(n);
keywords: 1. the circuit Cn has n input gates, one output gate, and can be computed by a deterministic algorithm in time poly(n);

children.name: 2. for every word input w of length n,

children.name: Proof of BPP via circuits
The inclusion circuits ⊆ BPP is immediate, so we focus on the converse inclusion.
keywords: The inclusion circuits ⊆ BPP is immediate, so we focus on the converse inclusion.

children.name: Consider a BPP algorithm, which is implemented by a Turing machine that runs in time p(n) and uses a coin tape.
keywords: Consider a BPP algorithm, which is implemented by a Turing machine that runs in time p(n) and uses a coin tape.

children.name: The n-th circuit computes the cells of the computation (in chronological order), and then says if the accepting state is seen.
keywords: The n-th circuit computes the cells of the computation (in chronological order), and then says if the accepting state is seen.

children.name: When the machine reads from the coin tape, a coin gate is used in the circuit.
keywords: When the machine reads from the coin tape, a coin gate is used in the circuit.

children.name: Fact. The following conditions are equivalent for a linear map
keywords: Fact. The following conditions are equivalent for a linear map

children.name: 1. the input has the same norm as the output
keywords: 1. the input has the same norm as the output

children.name: 2. if the input has norm 1, then the output output has norm 1
keywords: 2. if the input has norm 1, then the output output has norm 1

children.name: 3. the columns of the corresponding matrix are an orthonormal basis
keywords: 3. the columns of the corresponding matrix are an orthonormal basis

children.name: 4. the inverse of the corresponding matrix is its conjugate transpose.
keywords: 4. the inverse of the corresponding matrix is its conjugate transpose.

children.name: 5. the rows of the corresponding matrix are an orthonormal basis
keywords: 5. the rows of the corresponding matrix are an orthonormal basis

children.name: Such linear maps (or matrices) are called unitary
keywords: Such linear maps (or matrices) are called unitary

children.name: Conjugate transpose conditions
3. the columns of the corresponding matrix are an orthonormal basis
keywords: 3. the columns of the corresponding matrix are an orthonormal basis

children.name: A set of vectors is orthonormal if the vectors are unitary and pairwise orthogonal.
keywords: A set of vectors is orthonormal if the vectors are unitary and pairwise orthogonal.
